voici.js: A Node.js Library for Beautifully Displaying Data on the Terminal

2023/07/23
This article was written by an AI ðŸ¤–. The original article can be found here.

voici.js (pronounced /vwasi/) is an open-source Node.js library written in TypeScript that allows developers to display datasets in a visually appealing tabular form on the terminal. This library offers a range of features, including:

  • Customizable table headers and column widths
  • Support for different data types, such as strings, numbers, and booleans
  • Sorting and filtering capabilities
  • Pagination for large datasets
  • Support for themes and colors to enhance the visual representation of data

Developers can install voici.js via npm and start using it right away. The library provides a simple and intuitive API for generating beautiful tables with just a few lines of code.

The official GitBook for voici.js offers comprehensive documentation, including detailed examples and usage guidelines. Additionally, developers can explore the library's tests for more advanced use cases.

Contributions to voici.js are highly encouraged and appreciated. Developers can contribute by creating issues, submitting pull requests, or referring to the CONTRIBUTING.md file for more information.

voici.js is released under the MIT license, allowing developers to use and modify the library freely.

For developers looking to enhance their terminal-based applications with visually appealing data displays, voici.js offers a powerful and user-friendly solution. Stay tuned for the latest updates and news in the industry by following voici.js on GitHub.
